moves.1. d4 d5 2. e3 e6: I mimic these moves, keepng the board symmetric, freeing up the bishops and queen...
moves.3. Nf3 c5: ...but I break this, pressurising a pawn...
moves.5... Bb4: Now I pin the knight down...
moves.6. Bd2: ...but my opponent brings out his bishop, freeing his knight.
moves.6... Qa5: I unleash my queen to help my bishop...
moves.9. Bd3 Nf6: Now I bring up my knight...
moves.12... Qf4: Now I bring up my queen...
moves.13. Re1: ...and he lines up my pawn with a second piece...
moves.14. Qh5+: Now he attacks with his queen...
moves.15. Qe2 O-O: Now I bring out a rook...
moves.17... Qc7: ...but instead of taking it, I pressurise his queen...
moves.19. Qxd5+: ...but lose mine, with the queen attacking my king...
moves.19... Qf7: ...so I block with mine, keeping my pieces covered.
moves.22... Nc5: ...and I give mine extra cover with my knight...
moves.24. Qxf3: ...but as his queen takes mine, mine is now under pressure from a rook...
moves.24... Ne4: ...so I put my knight in between, not understanding why I really did this...
moves.25. Bb4: ...but as he declines to take it, he attacks my rook...
moves.25... Re8: ...so I put it behind my queen...
moves.26. h3 Bd7: ...and free its twin, by bringing up my bishop...
moves.27. Re2 Nxd2: ...and now I accept his knight, attacking his queen...
moves.30. c4 Rae8: Now I double up on the e-file...
moves.31. Kh2 Re6e2+: ...allowing me to simultaneously attack the king and a pawn...
moves.34... Bxd1: ...so I accept it, ending his challenge.
